alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:13PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Morgan County through 500 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairfield Glade, or 12 miles west of Wartburg, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and up to one half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wartburg, High Point, Pine Orchard and Frozen Head State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
